author: S Prasad
text:
‘Challenge before students is to convert knowledge into a democratic force’

K.S. Dasgupta, Director of Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST) said on Monday that the IIST was working very closely with all the centres of Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) relating to launch vehicles, payload design and nano satellites.

In a brief interaction with reporters on the sidelines of the Graduation Day function at Pondicherry Engineering College, Mr. Dasgupta expressed optimism that the outcomes of the collaboration would be very fruitful in the near future.

Later, in his Graduation Day address, the IIST chief underscored innovation and research as the key for nation-building and called for nurturing students in such a way that they become research oriented, he added.

“A good education inculcated the habit of tolerance of divergent views and options which would make us spiritually calm,” he added.
title: Innovation, research key for nation-building: IIST chief
